question: Astrocytes are capable of transporting substances between the blood and neurons.
Fetal heart tones can typically be heard with a fetal stethoscope between 16 and 19 weeks of gestation.
The transversalis fascia is continuous with the fascia on the inferior surface of the diaphragm.
Pericardial effusion typically presents with rapidly accumulating excess fluid causing cardiac tamponade due to compression of the heart.
Semispinalis capitis originates from the transverse processes of TI to TVI and inserts onto the medial area between the superior and inferior nuchal lines of the occipital bone.
